author: jgm
content:
Following up with some more maths: if `TARGET_AGGREGATORS_PER_SYNC_SUBCOMMITTEE` were increased to 8 this would result in around a 96% chance that there are aggregator for all subnets in an epoch, however over the period of a day it is still pretty much guaranteed that there will be at least one subcommittee without aggregators.  If `TARGET_AGGREGATORS_PER_SYNC_SUBCOMMITTEE` were increased to 16 that would pretty much solve the problem, but obviously then we're at a 1 in 8 chance of a sync committee member being an aggregator so a fair bit more overhead.

I would have preferred it if aggregators weren't rotated quite as quickly as every slot, but still think that the overhead of increasing `TARGET_AGGREGATORS_PER_SUNC_SUBCOMMITTEE` to 16 is going to be worthwhile in terms of the level of surety that sync committee messages will be included on the chain (or at least have a fighting chance of doing so).

<@!291925846556540928> thoughts on this?
